intro: Heterotheca marcbakeri, commonly known as the Marcbaker's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Heterotheca marcbakeri is often found in open areas such as grasslands and rocky soils.
